alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 10 at 4:11AM PST until March 12 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow with periods of heavy rain expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 12 inches, except 2 to 6 feet above 6500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph with gusts up to 120 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Very strong winds combined with heavy snow could cause tree damage and lead to power outages. Snow loading on structures will increase due to the additional rain and snow being absorbed into the deep snowpack, along with higher risks for dangerous roofalanches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will drop to 6000-6500 feet tonight into Saturday. Periods of higher snow levels could bring the risk of flooding in lower elevations, see the Flood Advisory for more details.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
